title: Sr. Director, Data Platform Engineering & Operations
shortDescription:
- Lead SIE’s Data + AI platform ecosystem (streaming/ingestion/warehouse, governance/observability).
- Operate at massive scale (millions of users; billions of data points/day).
- Stack mentions: Kafka, Databricks, Snowflake; governance tools (Alation/Collibra).
- Bay Area role (San Mateo).
fitRationale:
- Very aligned with enterprise-scale data/platform leadership + governance/observability.
- Strong bridge to AI platform strategy (Databricks/Snowflake + AI/ML adoption).
- Big-org, cross-functional exec leadership similar to your OpenText scope.

title: Head of Engineering (Platform)
shortDescription:
- Exec role reporting to CTO; lead Platform/Insurance group (eligibility, claims, billing, payments).
- Own org design + scaling multiple engineering pods.
- Emphasis on reliability/security in complex regulated domains.
- Mentions growth from ~150 to 250+ engineers.
fitRationale:
- Strong platform exec role with compliance-ish domain complexity (insurance/payments).
- Direct match to scaling high-impact platforms and operating model design.
- Not classic enterprise software, but the platform + regulated complexity fits your themes.

title: Vice President, Engineering
shortDescription:
- VP Eng reporting to CTO; build technical capabilities that accelerate clinical trials/drug dev.
- Heavy on data ingestion + RWE platforms + modeling/prediction pipelines.
- Explicit governance/compliance: GxP validation, security compliance, regulatory-first posture.
- Mentions LLM-integrated features + autonomous agents.
fitRationale:
- Great match on AI + data platform + governance/compliance posture (regulated workflows).
- True org leadership role (15+ engineers) with cross-functional C-level partnership.
- Downside: biotech/pharma domain focus; not traditional enterprise SaaS.

title: Director, Head of Platform Engineering
shortDescription:
- Lead Platform + Cloud Engineering; focus on DevOps/platform practices in AWS/Azure.
- Own CI/CD, IaC, monitoring/logging/alerting, DR/security/compliance.
- Mentions AWS ECS/Fargate/EC2; Python/Django apps; Kafka/Elastic/Redis.
- Mix of leadership + hands-on (role estimates include ~35% development).
fitRationale:
- Enterprise IT/platform leadership with strong governance + reliability requirements (finance).
- Good fit if you want a platform leadership role with meaningful hands-on architecture influence.
- Smaller org than your current scope, but operational rigor and compliance are aligned.

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Platform
shortDescription:
- Lead Platform Engineering org: Cloud Infra, SRE, internal dev tooling, platform services.
- Strong compliance posture: FedRAMP / NIST 800-63; secure-by-default platforms.
- Own reliability/SLAs, incident response, observability, Kubernetes/Terraform/Helm evolution.
- Explicit focus on developer velocity + guardrails/self-service.
fitRationale:
- Very aligned with governance/compliance + platform engineering leadership (federal standards).
- Bay Area location and cross-functional leadership scope map well to your platform/architecture background.
- Slightly below C-level, but strong pathway role with high leverage.

title: Senior Staff Data Platform Architect
shortDescription:
- Blueprint a modern cloud-native data/reporting/AI architecture; modernization mandate.
- Mentions lakehouse/data mesh/fabric; AI/ML Ops pipelines, feature stores, graph-based relationships.
- Strong governance: lineage/quality/privacy/security (GDPR/CCPA/PII).
- Stack mentions: Snowflake, Databricks, catalogs/CDPs; streaming/event-driven pipelines.
fitRationale:
- Direct hit on data platform architecture + governance/lineage + AI enablement.
- Good fit for “enterprise-grade” data architecture thinking (standards, semantic layers, golden datasets).
- More architect/IC than org leader, but high strategic influence.

title: AI Platform Lead Architect
shortDescription:
- Build secure, scalable access to LLMs across providers; agentic workflows + prompt management.
- Own training/fine-tuning/inference pipelines; vector DB/embedding store strategy.
- Backend services + APIs (Python/FastAPI) + operational ownership/on-call.
- Stack mentions: AWS, Databricks, Snowflake, Docker/Kubernetes, Terraform.
fitRationale:
- Strong alignment with AI platform leadership (LLM access layer, agentic tooling ecosystem).
- Good governance angle: secure access patterns + standardized procedures.
- Again more senior IC than exec, but very on-theme for AI/data platforms.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Platform
shortDescription:
- Build/maintain data infrastructure and tooling for Data Science/BI/analytics users.
- Batch + real-time pipelines (clickstream/DB/3rd party).
- Stack mentions: AWS (Redshift/MSK/EMR), Airflow/Python, Clickhouse, Kafka/Kinesis.
- Ownership from requirements through production monitoring/troubleshooting.
fitRationale:
- Strong signal on modern data platform engineering at meaningful scale.
- Less of a leadership step (IC role), but could be useful for market intel + networking.
- Fintech-ish adjacent domain; governance angle not central.

title: Sr. Software Engineer, Developer Experience
shortDescription:
- Platform Engineering / DevEx: remove friction across SDLC via tooling + workflow improvements.
- Drive adoption/influence without authority; pilot/validate practices with teams.
- Mentions GitHub Actions + experimenting with AI dev tools.
- Fully remote.
fitRationale:
- On-theme for platform leadership (developer productivity as a platform capability).
- Not a next-step role level-wise, but could be a useful signal of market + AI tooling adoption.
- Company scale is mid-market; enterprise/governance themes are lighter.

title: Principal Backend Engineer
shortDescription:
- Principal IC owning backend platform powering reading/writing/discovery at millions of users.
- Focus: distributed systems, reliability/performance, event-driven pipelines modernization.
- Mentions Kafka/Kubernetes/AWS/Datadog/GraphQL as nice-to-haves.
- Mentorship + technical direction responsibilities.
fitRationale:
- Strong platform-scale engineering, but not aligned to your leadership step (IC).
- Governance/compliance not central; consumer content domain.
- Included to round out today’s 10 with a high-signal platform-scale role.
